column4: mmmh, are there more repositories for ubuntu than the ones which are default? And where can I find them?
yes, but you don't get to wait hours for a few minutes worth of software
if he wants to take two days to do two hours work, he needs gentoo  :)
cant follow you?
me uses gentoo and I am more than happy, now I am helping him to configure his kubuntu install
not being exactly serious.  You get better performance from ubuntu than from gentoo, and you get it a with a lot less work
I love gentoo, so no way for logical argument :-)
all available
use synaptic.  it's a nice friendly gui app with a search function
or you can install from the command line with just the package name
you never need to download anything manually
just using adept manager from kde
why?  synaptic is a lot easier to use.  I use it in kde
because I have no clue of kubuntu and int was preinstalled :-)
ok.  no problem
and my frind just switched a few month ago from XP tu SuSE, but suse sucked, and didn't help him with suse
I'm not fond of suse
but package management in ubuntu is really very easy

I'm not sure about opera; I think you have to add a repository to the list of repositories to get opera
